message: After pushing through the pain for what feels like hours, the scene finally changes.
I'm walking through a warehouse. It's dimly lit and smells of rust.
Thick chains hang from the ceiling and metal boxes are scattered about.
At the end of the seemingly endless warehouse, there's a wall with an old-looking door.
Could Mink be on the other side?
On the other side is a small, square room. A familiar figure stands inside.
As I run toward him, Mink silently turns his head to look at me.
I close my eyes and concentrate on the image of us leaving this world.
